attires.name: Huipil
attires.description: The most common traditional garment worn by indigenous women from central Mexico to Central America. It is a loose-fitting tunic, generally made from two or three rectangular pieces of fabric which are then joined together with stitching, ribbons or fabric strips.

attires.name: Guayabera
attires.description: A men's summer shirt, worn outside the trousers, distinguished by two vertical rows of closely sewn pleats that run the length of the front and back of the shirt.

attires.name: Charro Suit
attires.description: A style of suit that originated in Mexico and is associated with the charro horsemen. It is characterized by its elaborate embroidery and silver buttons.
